title.narrative: Operational support to Capacity Building Project of Nigerian Joint Response Partners

description.narrative: Localization has become a major area that won the heart of many global actors/institutions and its success depends on commitments and deliberate efforts. The Nigerian Joint Response, through the support of the Dutch Relief Alliance has taken a bold step in ensuring the local partners working under the Joint Response are supported in all critical areas identified. For capacity strengthening support, Mentorship has been considered to be a vital process to support the capacity of local actors. NJR local partners have identified and prioritized their needs for Mentorship support. CAFOD will provide CRUDAN and its NJR local partners with a specialist (hereinafter referred to as mentor) in Procurement/value chain Systems, to ensure better and efficient processes and procurement system upgrade, and apply the learning in such a manner that shows a working system in a professional manner, where international and donor standards are maintained. The mentor will serve as advisor to the organizations, re-assess their capacity, support them in meeting up with international best practices and standards essentially required to deliver humanitarian assistance at local and international levels.
